name: Hard Beware of (Certain)  Women Quiz / Test | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Beware of getting involved with a woman from a "lower class".
questions.explanation:
A Place in the Sun.

	Monty Clift gets involved with working girl Shelley Winters and lives to regret it - (Liz Taylor has something to do with that.)  "Heiress" is the opposite situation: affluent woman (Olivia DeHavilland) and fortune-hunter (Clift). "Potato" deals with inter-racial marriage. "Robin Hood" involves a romance between a Saxon (Robin) and a Norman. (DeHavilland as Maid Marian).

questions.text: Beware of getting involved with your parents' lady friend.
questions.explanation:
The Graduate.

	Dustin Hoffman gets seduced by Anne Bancroft (as the now legendary Mrs. Robinson). "Columbus" involves a romance between working boy (Richard Benjamin) and a woman from an affluent family (Ali MacGraw). "Dinner" involves inter-racial marriage. "Heartbreak" also involves a working guy and a woman from an affluent family.

questions.text: Beware of marrying a woman who will torment you relentlessly.
questions.explanation:
Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?.

	"Woolf" has poor Richard Burton getting emotionally battered by Liz Taylor in the Edward Albee work (directed by Mike Nichols). "Love Story" involves a man from an affluent family (Ryan O'Neal) with a  woman from a working class background. (Ali MacGraw). "Hustler" and "Sunday" don't apply.

questions.text: Beware of getting involved with a woman who is also involved with your friend.
questions.explanation:
Trapeze.

	In "Trapeze", Burt Lancaster and Tony Curtis clash over Gina Lollobrigida. "Ivanhoe" involves a romance (of sorts) between a Jewish woman (Liz Taylor) and a non-Jewish man (Robert Taylor as Ivanhoe). "Detective" and "Itch" don't apply.

questions.text: Beware of getting drunk and waking up with a new wife.
questions.explanation:
How to Murder Your Wife.

	All are Jack Lemmon comedies, but "Murder" deals with the plot line mentioned in the question.

questions.text: Beware of getting involved with your son's girlfriend.
options: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
questions.explanation:
Damage.

	Jeremy Irons gets involved with his son's girlfriend - and everyone ends up the worse for wear.

questions.text: Beware of getting involved with someone other than your wife.
questions.explanation:
Guide for the Married Man.

	The movie consists of vignettes that contain cautionary "notes" for the would-be cheater.

questions.text: Beware of a woman who lures you into a plot to murder her husband - this applies to all of the following EXCEPT ...?
questions.explanation:
The Two Mrs. Carrolls

	The three wrong choices here are classics of film noir. John Garfield, Fred MacMurray and William Hurt are all selected for the murderous task. In "Carrolls", the husband (Bogart) is the villain and the wife (Barbara Stanwyck) is the potential victim.

questions.text: Beware of getting involved with a woman who will do anything to protect her daughter.
questions.explanation:
Mildred Pierce.

	Jack Carson wants Joan Crawford - who is only interested in protecting daughter Ann Blyth.

questions.text: Beware of getting involved with a woman who really doesn't care about you.
options: The Man Who Came to Dinner
questions.explanation:
Of Human Bondage.

	"Bondage" deals with the infatuation and obsession of a would-be doctor and artist with a lower class woman who uses him, but doesn't really care about him. (Bette Davis and Leslie Howard in the best version.)
